title: How to Make Pilau Rice with Stir Fry

steps.headline: Preheat the stovetop to medium heat.
steps.description: Lay a skillet on the stovetop. Sprinkle the cumin seeds over the skillet and cook for about thirty seconds. Stir them around with a wooden spoon and cook until roasted.

steps.headline: Add ghee or oil into the skillet with the cumin seeds.
Add the chopped onion and continue to cook for about 5-7 minutes under a lid on medium heat until the onion starts to soften.
Add the cardamon, cloves and turmeric to the onions and stir with a wooden spoon.
Rinse the rice thoroughly until the water runs clear and add it to the skillet.
steps.description: Pour the water into the skillet and add the salt, bay leaves and cinnamon sticks. Stir slowly with a wooden spoon and cover with the lid. Cook over low heat for about 12-15 until the water is absorbed.

steps.headline: Leave the rice in the skillet with the lid on away from the heat for about 12 minutes.
steps.description: While you wait, make the stir fry.

parts.name: Making the Stir Fry and Serving

steps.headline: In a small sized bowl combine the soy sauce, brown sugar and corn starch with a spoon until the mixture is smooth.
Add ginger, garlic and red pepper into the sauce mixture.
Add the chicken or beef into the sauce and marinate fully.
steps.description: Place the mixture in a bowl and refrigerate for about 15 minutes.

steps.headline: Drizzle oil over a large skillet and using the wooden spoon fry the bell pepper, chestnuts, broccoli, carrots and onion.
steps.description: Stir and cook for about 5 minutes, until the vegetables and chestnuts are tender. Remove from heat.

steps.headline: Remove the chicken or beef from the fridge.
steps.description: Strain the marinate and set aside for later use.

steps.headline: In a separate large skillet drizzle oil all over the skillet until fully coated.
steps.description: Fry the meat for about five minutes until it slightly cooks but not fully.

steps.headline: Stir in the fried vegetables and the marinade into the meat.
steps.description: Cook for about 5-7 minutes, until the meat is soft and fully cooked.

steps.headline: Get a serving plate and scoop rice into the dish.
steps.description: Add the stir fry on top. Enjoy!

text: Making the Pilau Rice Preheat the stovetop to medium heat. Lay a skillet on the stovetop. Sprinkle the cumin seeds over the skillet and cook for about thirty seconds. Stir them around with a wooden spoon and cook until roasted. Add ghee or oil into the skillet with the cumin seeds.  Add the chopped onion and continue to cook for about 5-7 minutes under a lid on medium heat until the onion starts to soften.  Add the cardamon, cloves and turmeric to the onions and stir with a wooden spoon.  Rinse the rice thoroughly until the water runs clear and add it to the skillet. Pour the water into the skillet and add the salt, bay leaves and cinnamon sticks. Stir slowly with a wooden spoon and cover with the lid. Cook over low heat for about 12-15 until the water is absorbed. Shut the stove off.  Leave the rice in the skillet with the lid on away from the heat for about 12 minutes. While you wait, make the stir fry. Making the Stir Fry and Serving In a small sized bowl combine the soy sauce, brown sugar and corn starch with a spoon until the mixture is smooth.  Add ginger, garlic and red pepper into the sauce mixture. Stir again with a spoon. Add the chicken or beef into the sauce and marinate fully. Place the mixture in a bowl and refrigerate for about 15 minutes. Drizzle oil over a large skillet and using the wooden spoon fry the bell pepper, chestnuts, broccoli, carrots and onion. Stir and cook for about 5 minutes, until the vegetables and chestnuts are tender. Remove from heat. Remove the chicken or beef from the fridge. Strain the marinate and set aside for later use. In a separate large skillet drizzle oil all over the skillet until fully coated. Fry the meat for about five minutes until it slightly cooks but not fully. Stir in the fried vegetables and the marinade into the meat. Cook for about 5-7 minutes, until the meat is soft and fully cooked. Get a serving plate and scoop rice into the dish. Add the stir fry on top. Enjoy!
